image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Secane, Delaware County, Pa., December 12, 1951; graduated from Cardinal O'Hara High School, Springfield, Pa., 1970; B.S., United States Naval Academy, Annapolis, Md., 1974; M.P.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1980; Ph.D., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1984; United States Navy, 1974-2005; vice admiral; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in 2016.

asset.name: S001169_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Sestak, Joseph Ambrose, Jr., "The Seventh Fleet: A Study of Variance Between Policy Directives and Military Force Postures," Ph. D. Diss, Harvard University, 1984.
